page.title: 09UPMINSTER WINDMILL
page.content: In 1802 James Noakes built the mill and his family owned it for 49 years. Then the Abraham family owned it. In 1934 Mr W.H. Simmons died and then Essex County Council planned to demolish it. Many people were against that idea. The London Borough of Havering own it now. After the Second World War some local residents and an old millwright restored it. There are four floors and their names are the dust floor, the bin floor, the meal floor and the gallery. The local historical society give visitors guided tours. If you are on the top floor on a clear day you can see the tallest buildings in the city of London.
